pros: Deep, plush cushioning; Rocker geometry for smooth transitions; Excellent for cold weather; Amazing stability; High-quality upper; Ideal for heel strikers; Can be used as a sneaker or travel shoe
cons: Heavyweight build; Not the most spacious toebox; High retail price; Low energy return
RR_verdict: The ASICS Gel Kinsei Max is massive, comfort-loaded, and unapologetically heavy. In our runs, it felt more like a lifestyle-performance hybrid than a solid daily trainer. We were surprised by its colossal GEL piece in the heel, which offered cloud-plush landings, but we think that the high weight and steep price tag make it a hard sell. In our opinion, it’s best suited for casual runners who want a bold-looking, comfortable option and don’t mind the extra heft underfoot.
awards: Top pick in best ASICS walking shoes
